com.epoch.genericQTypes

Class Choice

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.epoch.genericQTypes.Choice
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FormatConstants, ChoiceConstants

    public class Choice
extends Object
implements ChoiceConstants
    Holds a response to a multiple-choice or fill-blank question.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private long[] binaryArray
      Whether each option was chosen, in binary format.
      private boolean[] choices
      Array containing whether each parallel option was chosen.
      private List<Integer> chosenOptions
      List of chosen 1-based options.
      private int[] options
      Array containing the 1-based options in the order in which they were presented to the user.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Choice

        public Choice(String respStr)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        respStr - String representing the multiple-choice response; has the format 5:1+:2:4:3+ where each number is the option number, the order is the order of display, and + indicates the chosen options.
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - if numbers can't be parsed

      • Choice

        public Choice(String respStr,
              int numOptions)
        Constructor for logged responses (short format).
        Parameters:
        respStr - String representing the multiple-choice response; has the format 1:3: where each number is a chosen option
        numOptions - the number of options in the question

        public long[] getBinaryArray()

        array of chosen options

      • getStringChosenOptions

        public String getStringChosenOptions(boolean sort)
        Gets a response String of only the chosen options. Used by ResponseLogger.
        Parameters:
        sort - whether to return in the order that they were displayed or in sorted order.
        Returns:
        a String such as 2:4:

      • displayChosen

        public String displayChosen(QDatum[] qData,
                            boolean chemFormatting)
        Converts the chosen items into HTML format suitable for display.
        Parameters:
        qData - the question data that the item numbers represent
        chemFormatting - whether to use chemistry formatting
        Returns:
        the chosen items in HTML format

      • displayChosen

        public String displayChosen(QDatum[] qData,
                            boolean chemFormatting,
                            String[] userLangs)
        Converts the chosen items into HTML format suitable for a short display.
        Parameters:
        qData - the question data that the item numbers represent
        chemFormatting - whether to use chemistry formatting
        userLangs - non-English languages of the viewing user in order of preference
        Returns:
        the chosen items in HTML format

      • fillBlankToDisplay

        public String fillBlankToDisplay(String qStmt,
                                 QDatum[] qData)
        Adds choice items to a question statement of a fill-in-the-blank question, incorporating them into pulldown menus.
        Parameters:
        qStmt - the original question statement, containing [[1, 3, 4]] to indicate a dropdown menu containing 1-based question data numbers 1, 3, and 4.
        qData - the question data that the item numbers represent
        Returns:
        the modified question statement

      • fillBlankToDisplay

        public String fillBlankToDisplay(String qStmt,
                                 QDatum[] qData,
                                 boolean addMenus,
                                 boolean chemFormatting)
        Adds choice items to a question statement of a fill-in-the-blank question, perhaps incorporating them into pulldown menus.
        Parameters:
        qStmt - the original question statement, containing [[1, 3, 4]] to indicate a dropdown menu containing 1-based question data numbers 1, 3, and 4.
        qData - the question data that the item numbers represent
        addMenus - incorporate the items into pulldown menus
        chemFormatting - when true, convert to chemistry formatting
        Returns:
        the modified question statement

      • getOrderedItemNums

        private int[] getOrderedItemNums(String menuText)
        Gets the option numbers in the dropdown menu in the order given in the response.
        Parameters:
        menuText - the option numbers as a comma-separated string
        Returns:
        array of option numbers ordered as in the response

        public static String getOptions(String qStmt)
        Gets a string of options in the order in which they appear in a question statement.
        Parameters:
        qStmt - a question statement
        Returns:
        colon-separated string representing the options

      • getUnchosenString

        public String getUnchosenString()
        Returns a string with only the options in the received order.
        Returns:
        string of the options

      • getUnchosenString

        public static String getUnchosenString(String resp)
        Strips the student's choices from the response.
        Parameters:
        resp - the response
        Returns:
        the response with all choices stripped

      • getInitialString

        public static String getInitialString(int numOpts,
                                      boolean scramble,
                                      boolean exceptLast)
        Builds an initialized string.
        Parameters:
        numOpts - number of options
        scramble - whether to scramble the options
        exceptLast - if scrambling, whether to leave the last option last
        Returns:
        a string in the format 1:2:3: ..., maybe with options scrambled

      • getScrambledFillBlank

        public static String getScrambledFillBlank(int numOpts,
                                           String qStmt)
        Builds an initialized string for a fill-in-the-blank question in which the options are scrambled.
        Parameters:
        numOpts - the number of options
        qStmt - the question statement; contains information on which options can be scrambled with one another
        Returns:
        the initialized response
